title: India-US trade deal: Trump says not finalised; hints at 20-25% tariff rate 2 days ahead of deadline
content: US President Donald Trump has announced that a trade agreement with India has not been finalized, despite previous indications that a deal was nearing completion. Trump's remarks come just two days before the August 1, 2025, reciprocal tariff deadline. The possibility of an interim trade deal announcement before the deadline now seems unlikely.

title: Why India called Pak shortly after Op Sindoor strikes? PM Modi explains
content: Narendra Modi addressed the Lok Sabha, defending Operation Sindoor. He stated India informed Pakistan promptly after the operation. Modi criticized Congress for questioning the military's actions. He accused them of undermining the armed forces' morale. Modi blamed Congress for the loss of Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Amit Shah echoed similar views, citing Congress's historical blunders.

title: Op Sindoor debate: How Shashi Tharoor took centre stage in Lok Sabha
content: Amidst heated debates in Lok Sabha regarding Operation Sindoor, Shashi Tharoor's silence became a focal point. Despite leading a delegation to the US to garner support for India's cross-border action, Tharoor was not given a chance to speak, prompting PM Modi to indirectly criticise Congress. Tharoor's support for the government's stance has reportedly caused friction within the Congress party.

title: TCS layoffs: Ex Tech Mahindra CEO CP Gurnani quotes Sholay - message to techies
content: Amidst TCS layoffs, CP Gurnani urges the Indian tech industry to move beyond headcount obsession and embrace outcome-based models. He emphasizes a shift from the traditional pyramid structure, advocating for enhanced productivity, specialized skills, and advanced technological capabilities. Experts suggest that upskilling and reskilling are crucial for tech professionals in this evolving landscape.

title: India tests Pralay quasi-ballistic missile twice for conventional precision strikes
content: India successfully tested its Pralay quasi-ballistic missile, designed for precision strikes up to 500 km, twice off the Odisha coast. These tests pave the way for its induction into the armed forces, enhancing their conventional strike capabilities. The Pralay, crucial for the proposed Integrated Rocket Force, underwent user evaluation trials, validating its range and accuracy.

title: Op Sindoor: 'Why is he scared?' Cong revives Trump charge moments after PM junks it
content: Following PM Modi's denial of external interference in 'Operation Sindoor,' Congress launched a sharp counter-attack, questioning his silence on Donald Trump's claims of mediating between India and Pakistan. Congress leaders, including Rahul Gandhi, accused Modi of evading direct responses on Trump's assertions and failing to acknowledge China's support to Pakistan.

title: Meghnad Desai, eminent economist, passes away; PM Modi expresses condolences
content: Economist and House of Lords member Meghnad Desai passed away at 84. A former professor at the London School of Economics, Desai was known for his research on development, Marxian economics, and globalisation. Prime Minister Modi expressed condolences, acknowledging Desai's connection to India and his role in strengthening India-UK ties. Desai's influence spanned academia and politics.

title: Accenture executive says AI can speed up work, but won’t raise productivity unless
content: Artificial Intelligence tools can speed up tasks. However, Accenture's Ramine Tinati says it doesn't guarantee productivity. Companies need to redesign workflows for real gains. Some Asian firms are lagging in AI adoption. Tech giants like Amazon and Microsoft are investing heavily in AI. Nvidia's Jensen Huang and OpenAI's Sam Altman believe AI will change jobs.

title: TCS layoffs: Will new bench policy mean more than 12,000 firings? ‘Everyone is scared…’
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) faces employee anxieties as a new bench policy raises fears of layoffs exceeding the announced 12,000. The policy, limiting bench time to 35 days, may disproportionately impact senior staff struggling to secure project assignments quickly.

title: IPL jerseys stolen from Wankhede Stadium by security incharge, sold online
content: Farooque Aslam Khan, a security manager at Wankhede Stadium, has been arrested for allegedly stealing 261 IPL jerseys valued at Rs 6.52 lakh from the BCCI's merchandise store. The theft occurred on June 13, with Khan suspected of selling the stolen jerseys online. Following a complaint filed by BCCI officials, police have recovered 50 jerseys and are continuing their investigation.

title: High uric acid levels: Causes, symptoms, and natural ways to reduce them
content: High uric acid can lead to gout and kidney issues. Diet changes can help manage it. Reduce purine-rich foods like red meat. Avoid sugary drinks and alcohol. Staying hydrated is key for flushing out uric acid. Moderate coffee intake may help. Weight loss and managing blood sugar are beneficial. Fibre and vitamin C are important.

title: Bryan Johnson is planning to shut down or sell his anti-aging startup?
content: Bryan Johnson, the millionaire behind Project Blueprint, is considering shutting down or selling his anti-aging startup due to philosophical conflicts and difficulties in scaling his personalized protocols. He feels the business undermines his credibility in the philosophical space and distracts from his focus on 'Don't Die,' a belief system centered on radical life extension.

title: IMF raises global growth forecast to 3% for 2025; India, US, China see upgrades
content: The IMF has revised its global growth forecast upward for 2025 and 2026, anticipating a boost from early stockpiling ahead of US tariffs and a weaker dollar. While the US, China, and India are expected to see growth, global inflation is projected to ease, though the US may remain above target.

title: Gaza crisis: UK to recognise Palestinian state if Israel fails to act on ceasefire
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced the UK might recognise Palestine at the UN in September if Israel doesn't agree to a Gaza ceasefire and commit to a lasting peace. This decision follows mounting international pressure, including France's similar move. Starmer's plan, presented to President Trump, is conditional, urging Israel to halt hostilities and pursue a two-state solution, excluding Hamas.

title: Linda Hogan: 'I won’t attend Hulk’s funeral'; claims Brooke won’t either — family rift escalates
content: In a shocking turn, Linda Hogan posted a video alleging Brooke Hogan wouldn't attend Hulk Hogan's funeral, citing past trauma and family issues. The wrestling world mourns Hulk Hogan, who passed away on July 24, 2025, from cardiac arrest. However, the video featuring Brooke was later revealed as an AI-generated fake, sparking further controversy.

title: Vanessa Bryant reacts: Ciara’s sweet post for Russell Wilson; kids shine in family moment
content: Vanessa Bryant showed her support for Russell Wilson's family by commenting on Ciara's Instagram post, which featured the family cheering Wilson at training camp. This gesture highlights the strong bond between Vanessa and Ciara, who have supported each other through various life events, including Kobe Bryant's passing. Their families share a close friendship, celebrating milestones and vacations together.

title: Erin Burnett blasted: CNN anchor mislabels NYC shooter’s race; NFL HQ coverage sparks backlash
content: Erin Burnett, a CNN anchor, faces criticism for identifying the Park Avenue shooter as "possibly white" during a live broadcast, contradicting initial NYPD reports describing him as "possibly Middle Eastern." This sparked a social media backlash, raising concerns about racial assumptions and media responsibility in real-time news coverage. The shooter, Shane D. Tamura, killed four before fatally shooting himself.

title: 'Exercise to protect PM's image': Rahul on Op Sindoor; dares Modi to call Trump 'liar'
content: During the Operation Sindoor debate, Rahul Gandhi fiercely criticized PM Modi, alleging the exercise was to protect his image. Gandhi challenged Modi to refute Trump's claims about trade leverage and downed fighter jets. He questioned Modi's silence on Trump's meeting with Pakistan General Asim Munir, linked to the Pahalgam attack.

title: Alon Abutbul passes away: Tributes pour in for 'The Dark Knight Rises’ actor
content: Israeli actor Alon Abutbul, famed for his role in The Dark Knight Rises, tragically died at 60 after swimming at an unguarded beach near Haifa. He emerged from the water, reported feeling unwell, and collapsed. Despite extensive resuscitation efforts by paramedics, he was pronounced dead at the scene, leaving the entertainment community in mourning.

title: Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2: Ektaa Kapoor reveals how Shobha spotted Smriti Irani
content: After 25 years, Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi returns with a new season, marking Smriti Irani's comeback and reuniting the iconic Mihir-Tulsi pair. Ektaa Kapoor revealed that her mother, Shobha Kapoor, spotted Smriti in another show and insisted on casting her.

title: 'Voter IDs, chocolates': Shah refutes oppn's 'homegrown' terrorists claim
content: In a Lok Sabha showdown, Amit Shah strongly refuted P Chidambaram's doubts regarding Pakistan's role in the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor. Shah presented evidence, including NIA arrests and FSL reports, confirming the terrorists' identities and their Pakistani origin. He accused Chidambaram of giving Pakistan a clean chit and undermining the investigation.

title: Gabrielle Union reveals daughter Kaavia obsessed with marriage on vacation
content: Gabrielle Union shared a humorous anecdote about her daughter Kaavia's obsession with marriage during a family vacation in Hawaii. Kaavia, enamored with her best friend Crosby, declared him her husband without his knowledge, leading to comical and awkward situations throughout the trip. Union highlighted Kaavia's bold personality and the family's tradition of escaping to Hawaii for Christmas.

title: Marcus Morris Sr. arrested in Florida: Fraud charge filed; judge denies bond over bad check warrant
content: NBA veteran Marcus Morris Sr. faced a setback as a judge denied bond following his arrest in Florida on an out-of-state warrant related to a bad cheque. His lawyers argued for release to expedite debt repayment in Nevada, but the request was rejected. Morris, currently detained, faces fraud charges stemming from an alleged casino debt exceeding $1,200.

title: IND vs ENG: India's batting coach on Bumrah's availability - 'According to his load...'
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak hinted at Jasprit Bumrah's potential participation in the fifth Test against England, citing his current fitness based on workload assessments. Despite initial plans to limit Bumrah's appearances, his availability is under consideration.

title: Nadda vs Kharge sparks RS uproar; BJP chief withdraws remark, apologises
content: Rajya Sabha witnessed uproar as JP Nadda and Mallikarjun Kharge clashed during a debate on Operation Sindoor and the Pahalgam attack. Nadda's remark accusing Kharge of losing mental balance ignited protests, leading to demands for retraction. Despite initial resistance, Nadda apologized but urged for expunging Kharge's remarks against Prime Minister Modi.

title: IND vs ENG: Joe Root is not hunting down Sachin Tendulkar - Jos Buttler
content: Jos Buttler believes Joe Root isn't actively chasing Sachin Tendulkar's Test runs record, despite climbing to second on the all-time list, surpassing Ricky Ponting. Buttler highlights Root's exceptional form, especially since COVID, and his unwavering love for the game. While acknowledging the challenge, Buttler anticipates Root's hunger and fitness will keep him in contention to potentially reach the top spot.

title: Trump vs Harvard: A battle that tests American democracy's strength & price of intellectual freedom
content: In January 2025, Harvard University faced intense federal scrutiny following Donald Trump's second inauguration. Executive orders led to investigations, funding freezes, and visa threats, challenging academic freedom. Harvard fought back with lawsuits, but a potential settlement looms, raising concerns about political influence over university governance and research funding, setting a precedent for future administrations.

title: Union Pacific eyes Norfolk Southern merger to form first US transcontinental rail network
content: Union Pacific proposed to acquire Norfolk Southern for $85 billion. This deal aims to create a coast-to-coast freight railroad. The merger requires regulatory approval. It could reshape US freight logistics. Norfolk Southern's shareholders would receive cash and Union Pacific shares. The combined entity anticipates new revenue and cost savings. The companies will spend two years on integration plans.

title: 'Old habit': PM Modi slams Congress' 'negative approach' on strikes against Pak
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi attacked the Congress party in Parliament. He accused them of questioning army operations. Modi cited instances like the surgical strikes and Balakot airstrikes. He said Congress demanded proof and photographic evidence. Modi highlighted the return of pilot Abhinandan and a BSF jawan. He praised India's air defense system.

title: IND vs ENG: The Oval's last game had 1444 runs, 6 hundreds and a triple ton
content: The India-England Test series heads to a decisive finale at The Oval, where the toss could heavily influence the match, given the venue's recent high-scoring history. Surrey's mammoth 820/9 declared against Durham, featuring multiple centuries, raises questions about batting first.

title: 'Congress importing issues from Pakistan,' says PM Modi in LS - top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi asserted in Lok Sabha that India swiftly retaliated against the April 22 Pahalgam attack in just 22 minutes during Operation Sindoor. He accused the Congress party of being under Pakistan's influence and lacking the will to confront Pakistan's military infrastructure, highlighting India's strengthened defense capabilities and decisive actions against terrorism.

title: IND vs ENG: Broad: 'Stokes was right to take his cap off and offer handshake'
content: Stuart Broad defends Ben Stokes' offer to shake hands in the drawn fourth Test, acknowledging both sides' perspectives. Stokes, exhausted after 143 overs, sought to end the match, while Jadeja and Sundar, nearing centuries, rightfully pursued their milestones. Broad highlights the unique situation where both captain and batters had valid reasons for their actions in the game's final moments.

title: Sunjay Kapur’s wife Priya updates bio on Insta after joining his company's board
content: Following Sunjay Kapur's death, his mother, Rani Kapur, is alleging foul play and seeking clarity, claiming she was pressured into signing documents without full knowledge. Simultaneously, Sunjay's wife, Priya Sachdev, has joined Sona Comstar's board as a non-executive director and updated her Instagram profile, including a name change, before her account became unavailable, sparking speculation amidst the family's grief.

title: IND vs ENG | Gautam Gambhir vs curator fight: A complete timeline
content: Tensions flared ahead of the final India-England Test as Indian head coach Gautam Gambhir engaged in a heated exchange with Oval curator Lee Fortis. The disagreement arose from restrictions placed on the Indian team's access to the pitch, specifically regarding the distance they were allowed to stand and the curator's objections to their presence.

title: Copper wig incident: Fan crosses line in courtside clash; spectator ejected from arena; viral
content: During a recent WNBA game between the Phoenix Mercury and the Washington Mystics, an unexpected incident occurred when Kahleah Copper's wig was accidentally pulled off by Jade Melbourne. The game was briefly paused as Copper left the court. Later, a fan was ejected after Mercury players alerted officials to the fan's inappropriate behavior following the incident.

title: Dak Prescott turns 32: Dallas Cowboys send birthday shoutout; quarterback enters critical NFL season
content: Dak Prescott, Dallas Cowboys' quarterback, celebrated his 32nd birthday amidst high expectations for his tenth season. Despite impressive stats and regular-season success, Prescott faces scrutiny over his limited playoff victories. With offensive coordinator Brian Schottenheimer, the Cowboys aim to elevate Prescott's performance.

title: 'Tough to join': Rahane on Dhruv Jurel ahead of fifth Test at The Oval
content: Veteran batter Ajinkya Rahane lauded young wicketkeeper Dhruv Jurel for his solid performance in the fourth Test against England, stepping in after Rishabh Pant's injury. Rahane highlighted the difficulty of wicketkeeping in English conditions, praising Jurel's composure and valuable suggestions to captain and players.

title: 'First time in history ... ': Priyanka slams PM on Trump 'announcing' ceasefire
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra attacked Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding the ceasefire announcement made by US President Donald Trump. She questioned the government's accountability and accused them of prioritizing politics over public interest. Gandhi Vadra referenced Operation Sindoor and the understanding reached between India and Pakistan to end the conflict.

title: 'Played crucial role in eliminating cowardly terrorists': PM Modi hails Op Mahadev
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the armed forces for Operation Mahadev, which successfully neutralized three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir. Union Home Minister Amit Shah informed the Lok Sabha that the operation eliminated Suleman, Afghan, and Jibran, all A-category terrorists.

title: TCS layoffs: Amidst mass sackings, firm stops salary hikes & senior level hiring
content: TCS is freezing experienced hiring and global salary hikes amidst concerns over slow demand and AI's impact, potentially cutting 12,000 jobs. This move, impacting cities like Hyderabad and Chennai, sparks industry-wide discussions and worries about a talent "bloodbath."

title: IND vs ENG: The Oval curator shares his version after exchange with Gambhir
content: A heated exchange occurred between India head coach Gautam Gambhir and The Oval curator Lee Fortis regarding practice pitch conditions, prompting intervention from batting coach Sitanshu Kotak. Fortis remained tight-lipped about the specifics of the disagreement. In team news, Arshdeep Singh is set to make his Test debut as India aims to level the series against England in the fifth and final Test.

title: 'Only vidaai is left': Rajasthan MP’s quirky take on Operation Sindoor and Pakistan — watch
content: During a Parliament discussion on Operation Sindoor, Nagaur MP Hanuman Beniwal likened Pakistan to India's "wife," sparking laughter and controversy. His remark followed Union Home Minister Amit Shah's statement on the successful operations against terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack, emphasizing Pakistani involvement.

title: India-US trade deal: As Donald Trump's deadline nears, more talks needed
content: With Trump's tariffs looming, Indian and American officials are in intense discussions to find common ground on customs duties. Despite USTR Jamieson Greer indicating further talks are necessary and a trade deal unlikely soon, officials haven't dismissed a last-minute breakthrough. The next round of talks is scheduled for August 25.

title: NFL HQ shooting: Shane Tamura let one woman flee before targeting his next victims
content: Shane Tamura from Las Vegas caused a deadly shooting in Manhattan. The incident occurred at 345 Park Avenue. Tamura killed four people, including officer Didarul Islam. He used an M4 rifle. Tamura had driven from Las Vegas, crossing several states. Authorities confirmed his history of mental health issues. The shooting has sparked debates on gun control and mental health support.

title: IND vs ENG: Gambhir vs Oval curator: Batting coach reveals 'silly' reason
content: Tensions flared between India's head coach Gautam Gambhir and The Oval's pitch curator Lee Fortis during a training session, sparked by disagreements over pitch access and conduct. The situation escalated, requiring intervention from India's batting coach. This incident follows a series of on-field disagreements throughout the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, highlighting the intense atmosphere surrounding the matches.

title: Shooter targeted NFL HQ, claimed to have CTE
content: A gunman who killed four people at a Manhattan office building was trying to target the headquarters of the NFL but took the wrong elevator.

title: Arch Madness: Haslam downplays Manning talk
content: Browns co-owner Jimmy Haslam on Tuesday dismissed speculation that he is eyeing Texas quarterback Arch Manning in the 2026 NFL draft, saying "I would bet" Arch stays in college for two years.

title: Source: Colts' Raimann signs 4-year, $100M deal
content: Left tackle Bernhard Raimann has signed a contract extension with the Colts, which a team source confirmed is worth $100 million over four years.

title: Jets' Fields 'relieved' that toe injury wasn't worse
content: Jets quarterback Justin Fields will practice for a couple of weeks with a plastic shield on the outside of his cleats to protect his dislocated toe.

title: Sources: Cowboys CB Carson out for 4-6 weeks
content: Cowboys cornerback Caelen Carson is expected to miss 4-6 weeks after he suffered a hyperextended knee on Sunday, sources told ESPN.

title: Gators QB Lagway in boot as fall camp to open
content: Florida QB DJ Lagway will open fall camp watching from the sidelines in a walking boot with a calf strain. Said coach Billy Napier: "It's not ideal."

title: Venus joins US Open as mixed doubles wild card
content: Venus Williams and Reilly Opelka were one of 14 teams -- six via wild card -- announced Tuesday by the USTA for its mixed doubles event at the US Open in August.

title: Source: Raiders player offended by Wilkins' kiss
content: Christian Wilkins, who was released by the Raiders on Thursday, kissed a fellow player on the head and the teammate took offense to it, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: ⚾ Teammates, others remember Ryne Sandberg
content: Beloved on and off the field, Sandberg leaves a lasting legacy in Chicago and throughout the baseball universe.

title: Eugenio Suarez to where?! The one trade our experts would make before the deadline
content: A late-arriving trade season? No problem -- we asked our MLB experts for the one fun, outside-the-box deal they'd make to get things moving along.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Kwan to Jays? Maybe, but pitching comes first
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on July 31 approaches.

title: 11 college football teams ready to either build on last season or put it behind them
content: FSU has nowhere to go but up, Michigan can get way better, and Arizona State is building on its CFP berth. Which other teams are primed for bigger things in 2025?

title: Can Bronny James realistically make the Lakers’ rotation in Year 2?
content: After spending Year 1 working away from the spotlight, James hopes it'll translate into playing time with Los Angeles.

title: How Ichiro's HOF induction helps tell the story of Japanese baseball
content: On Ichiro Suzuki's induction weekend, a new exhibit in Cooperstown shares his place in the international baseball landscape.

title: Power Rankings: Sparks, Valkyries headed in opposite directions
content: Los Angeles rides a win streak (and Cameron Brink's return) up the latest edition, and Golden State struggles.

title: WNBA trades we want to see: Mabrey to Storm, Hines-Allen to Fever
content: Marina Mabrey, Aaliyah Edwards and Myisha Hines-Allen could be on the move before the trade deadline.

title: They (finally) meet again: Three keys to Liberty-Lynx WNBA Finals rematch
content: Injuries and new matchups will determine Wednesday's showdown, nine months after New York beat Minnesota for the title.

title: 'I'm getting that true balance': Dak Prescott's perspective as a dad and longest-tenured Cowboy
content: The quarterback enters Year 10 with the Cowboys, and he is focused on health, family and winning a Super Bowl.

title: Way-Too-Early men's Bracketology: Houston is No. 1, and we'll have a new WAC champ
content: Grand Canyon moved up its timeline to switch from the WAC to the Mountain West, which significantly shifts the bracket dynamics.

title: Liverpool won the Premier League and now they're on a spending spree. Why?
content: Fresh off winning the Premier League with few reinforcements, Liverpool are now splashing the cash in the summer transfer window ahead of the 2025-26 season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle eye Jackson to replace Liverpool-linked Isak
content: Jadon Sancho could make a permanent switch back to his old club Borussia Dortmund. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Liverpool still want Alexander Isak amid massive summer spending
content: Liverpool's pursuit of Isak is about future-proofing the team so that they're ready for life beyond Mo Salah.

title: Pelton's NBA offseason grades: Who aced their summer -- and who got the only 'F'
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: Reliever stock watch: Guardians look to Cade Smith
content: As the MLB trade deadline approaches this week, here are the relief pitchers and closers to keep an eye on in fantasy baseball.

title: Six late-round 'fliers' who can help you win your league
content: Hitting on a player late in drafts can be a big boost -- to your team and your ego. Here are six "fliers" you need to be considering.

title: Clay's Playbook: A game plan for your draft day
content: Mike Clay goes position by position and lays out a successful approach for 2025 fantasy football drafts.

title: Ranking every prospect dealt before the 2025 MLB trade deadline
content: You know the major leaguers on the move -- but what about the potential stars of tomorrow headed the other way in those deals?

title: Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton proposes to girlfriend Jade Jones
content: Haliburton staged the proposal inside Hilton Coliseum on the Iowa State campus, where the couple began dating.

title: 'The story's not done yet': England celebrate Euro 2025 win with London parade
content: England partied with 65,000 fans (and Burna Boy) outside Buckingham Palace after winning Euro 2025. But they already have one eye on the World Cup.

title: Cincy on the up after tight draw vs. Messi-less Miami
content: Cincinnati is looking like one of the league's best again after taking the fight to Miami, climbing the latest edition of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: Supriya Sule alleges ‘₹4,800-crore scam’ in Ladki Bahin Yojana
content: Her allegations come two days after the Maharashtra government announced a temporary suspension of ₹1,500 monthly aid to 26.34 lakh beneficiaries following a verification drive

title: Congress MLAs play flute before ‘buffalo’ in unique protest at M.P. Assembly; Speaker asks ministers to give direct answers
content: Congress MLAs enacted the popular Hindi saying ‘bhains ke aage been bajana (playing flute before a buffalo)’ which means that there is no point of saying anything to someone who won’t do anything about it

title: Writers, progressive thinkers oppose reduction of SSLC pass percentage in Karnataka
content: Writers, progressive thinkers, and educationists have written a letter to the Chief Minister in this regard

title: Kerala High Court yet again expresses displeasure at shoddy condition of Kochi roads
content: Potholes abound on MG Road and Banerjee Road; unscientific and damaged manhole covers and undulating paver blocks also a cause for concern, says court

title: Navy Chief on four-day visit to Japan to boost defence and maritime cooperation
content: The Chief Admiral CNS is scheduled to hold bilateral discussions with senior Japanese government officials including Minister of Defence, Gen Nakatani

title: MA&UD approves 11 projects to enhance urban liveability
content: Approved projects include development of waste to energy facility in Kurnool, Kadapa, Nellore and Kakinada-Rajahmundry, construction of a modern bus stand in Chittoor, monetisation of land at Rushikonda and ropeway to Kailasagiri

title: Will make efforts to enhance devotee experience during Dasara: NTR Collector
content: Number of devotees visiting the temple during the 10-day festivities has been increasing every year, and this year around 1 lakh devotees are expected every day, says G. Lakshmisha

title: Five new corporations under GBA: Final notification to come out on September 2
content: Public invited to file objections, if any, to the draft notification by August 18; delimitation process to be conducted on September 8

title: Mamata unfazed after Delhi police claim video she posted was fabricated
content: Hundreds of migrant workers from West Bengal have alleged harassment and torture by police in different states, including Delhi, because they are suspected of being Bangladeshi nationals

title: In Lok Sabha, Amit Shah hits out at Chidambaram over terrorists’ link to Pakistan
content: The Home Minister says there is evidence that the three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam terror attack were Pakistanis because Pakistani voter numbers of two out of three terrorists are available and the chocolates found with them were also made in Pakistan

title: Meghnad Desai, eminent Indian-born economist and author, dies at 85
content: Described as being at the “forefront of discussions on Indian public policy for many years”, Desai also had an illustrious teaching career

title: Rajnath urges international community to curb terror funding, labels Pakistan as ‘nursery of terrorism’ in Rajya Sabha
content: Defence Minister initiates debate on Operation Sindoor in Rajya Sabha; criticises UNSC’s appointment of Pakistan to counter-terror panel

title: Gujarat High Court acquits three in 2002 post-Godhra riots case, cites lack of ‘reliable evidence’
content: The three men were accused of being part of a mob in Anand that damaged and set shops on fire, violating prohibitory orders issued under Section 135 of the Bombay Police Act

title: DGCA audit flags 51 safety lapses in Air India operations
content: The Tata Group-owned airline is already facing warning notices for running planes without checking emergency equipment, not changing engine parts in time and forging records, along with other lapses related to crew fatigue management.

title: "Not A Complete Closure": Pahalgam Victim's Father On Operation Mahadev
content: This is a closure, but not a complete closure, Rajesh Narwal, the father of Jammu and Kashmir terror attack victim naval officer Lieutenant Vinay Narwal, told NDTV, a day after the Army eliminated three terrorists in an encounter near Srinagar.

title: FIR Lodged Against Applicant Behind 'Dog Babu' Residence Certificate In Patna
content: A residence certificate was recently issued in rural Patna in favour of one four-legged 'dog babu', born to parents with similar canine nomenclature, prompting a red-faced administration to lodge an FIR again

title: Survey Finds Fictitious Voters Registered In Bengal, Probe Ordered
content: An attempt at voter list manipulation in Bengal is suspected after a small audit revealed serious violations in the handling of Election Commission's Form 6, used to register new voters.

title: 3 Minors Break Into Friend's House In Delhi, Steal Gold, Other Valuables
content: Three teenagers were detained for allegedly breaking into the house of their friend in Delhi's RK Puram area, an official on Tuesday said.

title: Survey Finds Fictitious Voters Registered In Bengal, Probe Ordered
content: An attempt at voter list manipulation in Bengal is suspected after a small audit revealed serious violations in the handling of Election Commission's Form 6, used to register new voters.

title: TCS Market Valuation Erodes By Rs 28,149 crore Since Layoff Announcement
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has lost Rs 28,148.72 crore from its market valuation in two days after the company announced that it will lay off about 12,000 employees of its global workforce this year.

title: Another MNS 'Slapgate' In Thane, This Time Over Students Visiting Gamezone
content: Another day, another instance of assault by Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers. However, this time around, it was not about language.

title: Drug Supplier Disguised As Ascetic Caught After Evading Arrest For 3 Years In Rajasthan
content: Disguised as an 'ascetic', with black robes, Purna Ram, a known drug supplier from Rajasthan's Hanumangarh, has been caught by the police after evading arrest for three years.

title: All You Need To Know About New York Office Building Shooting That Killed 4
content: A man with a rifle killed an off-duty New York City police officer and three other people before taking his own life at a Manhattan office tower on Monday, according to officials.

title: France To Air-Drop 40 Tonnes Of Aid Into Gaza As Famine Unfolds
content: France will air-drop 40 tonnes of aid into Gaza from Friday, Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot said on Tuesday, as UN-backed experts warned the Israeli-blockaded Palestinian territory was slipping into famine.

title: Illegal, Unlicensed Medicines Worth Rs 1.3 Crore Seized from Delhi Flat
content: The Delhi Drugs Control Department on Tuesday seized unlicensed medicines worth over Rs 1.3 crore from a flat in Paschim Vihar. Officials said the drugs were being stored illegally for sale.

title: Complaint Against Mamata Banerjee For Post Alleging Delhi Cops Beat Up Woman
content: The BJP's Soumendu Adhikari - brother of Leader of the Opposition in Bengal assembly Suvendu Adhikari -- has filed a complaint with the Delhi Police, accusing Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee of spreading fake news on social media.

title: German Zoo Kills 12 Healthy Baboons Due To Lack Of Space, Faces Backlash
content: A zoo in the German city of Nuremberg said it killed 12 baboons on Tuesday despite protests, capping a saga rooted in concerns that the zoo had too little space to house a growing group of the animals.

title: Man Marries Woman From Same Area, Punjab Villagers Thrash His Mother
content: A mother was beaten in Ghalkalan village of Moga in Punjab after her son had a love marriage with a woman from the same village, which was against an archaic diktat by the village's panchayat.

title: How Many Palestinians Has Israel's Gaza Offensive Killed?
content: Palestinian health authorities say Israel's ground and air campaign against Hamas militants in the Gaza Strip has killed more than 60,000 people, with nearly a third of the dead under the age of 18.

title: 'Never Said Trump Was Lying, No Mention Of China': Rahul Gandhi On PM Speech
content: LoP Rahul Gandhi criticised PM Modi for not naming China in his address during the Operation Sindoor discussion and for not directly refuting US President Donald Trump's claims of brokering peace between India and Pakistan.

title: 'Tried To Push Saffron Terror Narrative': PM Slams Congress In House Speech
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched a blistering attack on the Congress during his reply to the debate on Operation Sindoor in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday, accusing the party of decades-long inaction against terrorism due to its "appeasement politics"

title: Top Court Extends Vikas Yadav's Interim Bail By A Month In Nitish Katara Murder Case
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday extended by four weeks the interim bail granted to Vikas Yadav, undergoing a 25-year jail term in the 2002 Nitish Katara murder case, to attend to his ailing mother.

title: "Judiciary Failed Me": Judge Resigns Over Senior's High Court Appointment
content: A woman civil judge resigned today after a senior she accused of harassment and misconduct was appointed as the judge of the Madhya Pradesh High Court recently.

title: Assam begins eviction drive to clear encroached forest land on Nagaland boundary
content: The settlers had turned vast swathes of land in the Rengma Reserve Forest into betel nut plantations, officials said

title: Lawyers cannot be summoned by agencies for giving legal advice to clients: Supreme Court
content: The petitioners expressed concern over the ‘chilling effect’ that ‘arbitrary summoning’ could have on the legal profession

title: Opposition parties in Lok Sabha question the government on accountability for the Pahalgam terror attack, ‘ineffective’ foreign policy
content: Lok Sabha member from Wayanad and Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asserted that leadership was not just about taking credit but also about owning responsibility

title: IUML, Sudheeran back Satheesan in dispute with Vellappally
content: Satheesan and Vellappally  had crossed swords after the latter alleged that minority vote banks, chiefly in north Kerala, wielded more political capital in the State than the majority community, principally the sizeable Ezhava community

title: Countdown begins for NISAR satellite launch
content: The NISAR satellite will scan Earth and provide all-weather, day-and-night data at 12-day intervals, and enable a wide range of applications

title: Tamil Nadu Skill Development Corporation inks MoU with Google Play to train students as game developers
content: A memorandum of understanding has been signed between the Tamil Nadu Skill Development Corporation and Google Play and Unity to train computer science students under the ‘Naan Mudhalvan’ programme

title: BMRCL likely to scale down tree felling target from 11,000 to 6,000 for metro phase 3
content: The BMRCL has proposed a compensatory afforestation initiative valued at ₹43.53 crore as part of its environmental monitoring strategy

title:
Sub-Inspector couple suspended as the police probe their role in Tirunelveli 
caste killing
content: Preliminary investigation reveals that the accused made many calls to the victim in the last three days leading to the murder. The weapon used in the offence has been seized

title: Youth Congress workers stage protest at Anert office
content: Protest demanding probe into alleged irregularities and corruption involved in the implementation of the PM-KUSUM scheme

title: Andhra Pradesh government forms committees for Partnership Summit 2025 in Visakhapatnam
content: Summit to focus on economic transformation and industrial growth as part of Swarna Andhra@2047 vision

title: Education Ministry issues LOIs for four foreign universities to set up campus in India
content: Australia’s Western Sydney University (WSU), Victoria University, La Trobe University and U.K.’s University of Bristol will be establishing their campuses in the country by offering both undergraduate and postgraduate degrees

title: In India’s first outreach to post-Assad regime, MEA Joint Secretary meets Syrian Foreign Minister Al-Shaibani
content: JS Suresh Kumar meets Syrian Health Minister, continuing pharma cooperation talks; India hands over 5 MT consignment of life-saving drugs; new Syrian government headed by former Al Qaeda leader

title: Constitute grievance panel for NEET candidates facing technical issues: Delhi High Court tells NTA
content: Court says exam time loss not due to candidates’ fault must be assessed by expert panel; directs transparent redress mechanism

title: CPI (M) leaders stop technicians from installing smart meters in Ongole
content: It is unfair to install smart prepaid meters without the consent of consumers and without explaining to them the risks associated with them, says CPI (M) Ongole secretary Ch. Srinivasa Rao

title: Smart ration cards to be given to 1.45 crore beneficiaries in A.P. from August 25
content: Andhra Pradesh became the first State in India to complete 96.05% KYC for ration cards, says Minister Nadendla Manohar

title: Wayanad to pay tribute to landslide victims on first anniversary on Wednesday
content: There will be an all-religion prayer and floral tributes at the graveyard on Harrison Malayalam tea estate at Puthumala, where dozens of victims were buried. Revenue Minister K. Rajan, Forest Minister A.K. Saseendran, SC/ST Welfare Minister O.R. Kelu, Public Works Minister P.A. Mohammed Riyas, Wayanad’s MP Priyanka Gandhi, T. Siddeeque, MLA, I.C. Balakrishnan, MLA, district panchayat president Samshad Marakkar, District Collector D.R. Meghashree and several civic heads will attend the functions.

title: Supreme Court asks if Tamil Nadu govt is trying to delay Senthilbalaji trials by arraigning more accused
content: The Bench queries whether individuals compelled to pay for jobs are arraigned as accused. “You (State) are more keen to prosecute them so that in the entire lifetime of the Minister, the trial proceedings never come to an end,” it observes. There are around 2,300 accused in the scam-related cases

title: HC calls for road audits in State
content: Court attributes systemic failures in upkeep of roads and slack traffic-rule enforcement as reasons for the increasing number of accidents in the State

title: Nadahalli says State govt. has failed to streamline urea distribution to farmers
content: ‘I have clear information that N. Chaluvarayaswamy is behind this and he is unfit to hold the portfolio as he neither understands agriculture nor does he care for farmers’

title: On anniversary of Wayanad landslides, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan calls for joint efforts to complete rehabilitation
content: Chief Minister praises survivors and rescue efforts after natural disaster, highlighting Kerala’s unity and support for victims.

title: DRDO conducts back-to-back Pralay missile test flights off Odisha
content: The missiles precisely followed the intended trajectory and reached the target point with pinpoint accuracy, meeting all the test objectives, the Ministry of Defence said

title: Kerala nuns’ arrest reignites political and ecclesiastical fault lines in State ahead of polls
content: The nuns’ arrest appears to have stirred unrest within the Catholic Church, with a section of the clergy voicing concerns over the silence of certain Bishops, some of whom had earlier publicly lauded the BJP’s national leadership and cultivated ties with party leaders at the local level

title: Welfare schemes in A.P. continue despite ₹16,000 crore fiscal deficit, says Excise Minister
content: Kollu Ravindra says about 95% promises made before the elections have been fulfilled by the government, pensions were increased and paid to the beneficiaries along with arrears

title: 'He called me several times but ... ': PM on his call with US VP during Op Sindoor
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'Death to Trump': Indian man charged with threat to bomb plane in UK

title: From the Texans to the 49ers, our ranking of every team based on under-25 talent
content: for the third straight year, the Houston Texans are no. 1 on this list of teams with the most under-25 talent . a year ago, the texans were way ahead of everyone else when it came to ranking talent under 25 years old .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Nabers appears 'OK' after shoulder injury scare
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room .

title: Brock Purdy and wife, Jenna, announce birth of first child
content: Purdy's wife, Jenna, gave birth to the couple's first child, millie Joleen . the 49ers' new arrival came nearly two weeks after star running back Christian McCaffrey and his wife had their first child .

title: Why Ichiro, CC Sabathia and Billy Wagner are Hall of Famers
content: Ichiro Suzuki, CC Sabathia and Billy Wagner are inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame . the trio stands out for their disparate backgrounds . they were a star in the Japan Pacific League at 20 years old before becoming the first Japanese position player .

title: Reinier de Ridder surges into the middleweight top 10
content: Reinier de Ridder is a top contender in the 185-pound division . he now owns a spot in the ESPN middleweight rankings, bumping Whittaker down a couple of spots in the top 10 . here are the current pound-for-pound MMA rankings .

title: 'It's about standards and details': Man United, Amorim aiming to start anew
content: Ruben Amorim arrived in the us for man united's preseason tour with a smile back on his face . he snapped back at reporters who suggested the performance had been poor . but time back in Portugal has allowed for a reset and at the start of a pivotal summer for the club .

title: EA Sports reveals full Madden NFL 26 99 Club
content: Saquon Barkley was confirmed as a member of the iconic 99 Club in madden NFL 26 . he won't be the only Philadelphia Eagles player to start off with a 99 OVR . his blocking stats are well over 90 except for mid-distance accuracy .
